column4: I've concluded using Ubuntu to host a DHCP server is near impossible for a noob. (me)
Have you read the Ubuntu Server Guide? It has a chapter on setting up dhcp https://help.ubuntu.com/9.10/serverguide/C/
Thanks for the link. Yeah I've read it.  I think my network card just isn't being detected or something.  My /etc/network/interfaces file only had eth0
eth0 is being used for my DSL so I wanted to use eth1 for DHCP
eth0 and eth1? Is eth1 wired or wireless?
You just need to add a static entry for it in interfaces. https://help.ubuntu.com/9.10/serverguide/C/network-configuration.html
yes eth0 and eth1 both are ethernet
Yes, or just take up/down the specific device with ''sudo ifup eth1''/''sudo ifdown eth1''
Expected if you haven't already brought it up with ifup
pastebinit is not installed by default, so you may need to install it.
Replace the network line with a netmask line. ''netmask 255.255.255.0'' for instance.
''man interfaces'' explains the syntax of that file btw.
